item.description: Biography Steven Puttemans is working as a post-doctoral researcher at EAVISE research group, which is part of the KU Leuven, Department of Industrial Engineering Sciences. He mainly focusses on bridging the valley-of-death, by translating state-of-the-art artificially intelligent computer vision algorithms, developed in academic context, to practical and usable solutions for industrial challenges. Steven is an active participant in the OpenCV community, being one of the main Q&A moderators and a frequent supplier of bug fixes and improvements to the framework.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: During my (post-)doctoral track I have organised several academic courses Scientific seminars (2017 - now) Research methodologies (2018 - now) Computer vision hands-on labs using the OpenCV framework (2015 - now) Scientific project for second year students (2014 - 2017) Topic 1: 360 degree panoramic photo helm Topic 2: Building a laser line based 3D scanner Topic 3: (2x) Building an anti burglar system using sensor fusion Topic 4: Mini-me in 3D (creating + printing 3D models of students) Topic 5: (2x) Marker based augmented reality Introductory XHTML and CSS classes (2012) Introductory Matlab classes (2012) Furthermore I have been a daily supervisor for several master thesisses
